verses.text: And it came to pass, when he had made an \w end|strong="H3615"\w* of \w speaking|strong="H1696"\w* unto \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*, that the \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* of \w Jonathan|strong="H3083"\w* was \w knit|strong="H7194"\w* with the \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and \w Jonathan|strong="H3083"\w* \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* him as his own \w soul|strong="H5315"\w*.

And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* him that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, and would \w let|strong="H5414"\w* him go no more \w home|strong="H7725"\w* to his \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

Then \w Jonathan|strong="H3083"\w* and \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w made|strong="H3772"\w* a \w covenant|strong="H1285"\w*, because he \w loved|strong="H0160"\w* him as his own \w soul|strong="H5315"\w*.

And \w Jonathan|strong="H3083"\w* \w stripped|strong="H6584"\w* himself of the \w robe|strong="H4598"\w* that \add was\add* upon him, and \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* it to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and his \w garments|strong="H4055"\w*, even to his \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*, and to his \w bow|strong="H7198"\w*, and to his \w girdle|strong="H2289"\w*.

¶ And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* whithersoever \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* him, \add and\add* behaved himself \w wisely|strong="H7919"\w*: and \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w set|strong="H7760"\w* him over the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w*, and he was \w accepted|strong="H3190"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and also in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of \w Saul’s|strong="H7586"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*.\f + \fr 18.5 \ft behaved…: or, prospered\f*

And it came to pass as they \w came|strong="H0935"\w*, when \w David|strong="H1732"\w* was \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* from the \w slaughter|strong="H5221"\w* of the \w Philistine|strong="H6430"\w*, that the \w women|strong="H0802"\w* came \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of all \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, \w singing|strong="H7891"\w* and \w dancing|strong="H4246"\w*, to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*, with \w tabrets|strong="H8596"\w*, with \w joy|strong="H8057"\w*, and with instruments of \w musick|strong="H7991"\w*.\f + \fr 18.6 \ft Philistine: or, Philistines\f*\f + \fr 18.6 \ft instruments…: Heb. three stringed instruments\f*

And the \w women|strong="H0802"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* \add one another\add* as they \w played|strong="H7832"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* hath \w slain|strong="H5221"\w* his \w thousands|strong="H0505"\w*, and \w David|strong="H1732"\w* his ten \w thousands|strong="H7233"\w*.

And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* was \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w wroth|strong="H2734"\w*, and the \w saying|strong="H1697"\w* \w displeased|strong="H3415"\w* him; and he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, They have \w ascribed|strong="H5414"\w* unto \w David|strong="H1732"\w* ten \w thousands|strong="H7233"\w*, and to me they have \w ascribed|strong="H5414"\w* \add but\add* \w thousands|strong="H0505"\w*: and \add what\add* can he have more but the \w kingdom|strong="H4410"\w*?\f + \fr 18.8 \ft displeased him: Heb. was evil in his eyes\f*
And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w eyed|strong="H5770"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* from that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* and \w forward|strong="H1973"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass on the \w morrow|strong="H4283"\w*, that the \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* from \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w came|strong="H6743"\w* upon \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*, and he \w prophesied|strong="H5012"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w*: and \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w played|strong="H5059"\w* with his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, as at other \w times|strong="H3117"\w*: and \add there was\add* a \w javelin|strong="H2595"\w* in \w Saul’s|strong="H7586"\w* \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*.

And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w cast|strong="H2904"\w* the \w javelin|strong="H2595"\w*; for he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I will \w smite|strong="H5221"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* even to the \w wall|strong="H7023"\w* \add with it\add*. And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* avoided \w out|strong="H5437"\w* of his \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* \w twice|strong="H6471"\w*.

¶ And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* was \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* \w of|strong="H6440"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was with him, and was \w departed|strong="H5493"\w* from \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*.

Therefore \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w removed|strong="H5493"\w* him from him, and \w made|strong="H7760"\w* him his \w captain|strong="H8269"\w* over a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w*; and he went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* and came \w in|strong="H0935"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* behaved himself \w wisely|strong="H7919"\w* in all his \w ways|strong="H1870"\w*; and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add was\add* with him.\f + \fr 18.14 \ft behaved…: or, prospered\f*

Wherefore when \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that he \w behaved|strong="H7919"\w* himself \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w wisely|strong="H7919"\w*, he was \w afraid|strong="H1481"\w* \w of|strong="H6440"\w* him.

But all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* and \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, because he went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* and came \w in|strong="H0935"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* them.

¶ And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, Behold my \w elder|strong="H1419"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* \w Merab|strong="H4764"\w*, her will I \w give|strong="H5414"\w* thee to \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*: only be thou \w valiant|strong="H1121"\w* for me, and \w fight|strong="H3898"\w* the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w battles|strong="H4421"\w*. For \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Let not mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* be upon him, but let the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w* be upon him.\f + \fr 18.17 \ft valiant: Heb. a son of valour\f*

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*, Who \add am\add* I? and what \add is\add* my \w life|strong="H2416"\w*, \add or\add* my \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w family|strong="H4940"\w* in \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, that I should be son in \w law|strong="H2860"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*?

But it came to pass at the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* when \w Merab|strong="H4764"\w* \w Saul’s|strong="H7586"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* should have been \w given|strong="H5414"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, that she was \w given|strong="H5414"\w* unto \w Adriel|strong="H5741"\w* the \w Meholathite|strong="H4259"\w* to \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*.

And \w Michal|strong="H4324"\w* \w Saul’s|strong="H7586"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*: and they \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*, and the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* \w pleased|strong="H3474"\w* him.\f + \fr 18.20 \ft pleased him: Heb. was right in his eyes\f*

And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I will \w give|strong="H5414"\w* him her, that she may be a \w snare|strong="H4170"\w* to him, and that the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w* may be against him. Wherefore \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, Thou shalt this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* be my son in \w law|strong="H2859"\w* in \add the one of\add* the \w twain|strong="H8147"\w*.

¶ And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, \add saying\add*, \w Commune|strong="H1696"\w* with \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w secretly|strong="H3909"\w*, and \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, Behold, the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* hath \w delight|strong="H2654"\w* in thee, and all his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w love|strong="H0157"\w* thee: now therefore be the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* son in \w law|strong="H2859"\w*.

And \w Saul’s|strong="H7586"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* those \w words|strong="H1697"\w* in the \w ears|strong="H0241"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*. And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Seemeth|strong="H5869"\w* it to you \add a\add* \w light|strong="H7043"\w* \add thing\add* to be a \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* son in \w law|strong="H2859"\w*, seeing that I \add am\add* a \w poor|strong="H7326"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w*, and lightly \w esteemed|strong="H7034"\w*?

And the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w told|strong="H5046"\w* him, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, On this \w manner|strong="H1697"\w* \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*.\f + \fr 18.24 \ft On…: Heb. According to these words\f*

And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Thus shall ye \w say|strong="H0559"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, The \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w desireth|strong="H2656"\w* not any \w dowry|strong="H4119"\w*, but an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w foreskins|strong="H6190"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w*, to be \w avenged|strong="H5358"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*. But \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w thought|strong="H2803"\w* to make \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* by the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w*.

And when his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* these \w words|strong="H1697"\w*, it \w pleased|strong="H3474"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* well to be the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* son in \w law|strong="H2859"\w*: and the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* were not \w expired|strong="H4390"\w*.\f + \fr 18.26 \ft expired: Heb. fulfilled\f*

Wherefore \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w* and \w went|strong="H3212"\w*, he and his \w men|strong="H0582"\w*, and \w slew|strong="H5221"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w* two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w*; and \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* their \w foreskins|strong="H6190"\w*, and they gave them in full \w tale|strong="H4390"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, that he might be the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* son in \w law|strong="H2859"\w*. And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* him \w Michal|strong="H4324"\w* his \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* to \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*.

¶ And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* and \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add was\add* with \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and \add that\add* \w Michal|strong="H4324"\w* \w Saul’s|strong="H7586"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* him.

And \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* was yet the \w more|strong="H3254"\w* \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* \w of|strong="H6440"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*; and \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* became \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w* \w continually|strong="H3117"\w*.

Then the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w* went \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*: and it came to pass, \w after|strong="H1767"\w* they went \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*, \add that\add* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* behaved himself more \w wisely|strong="H7919"\w* than all the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*; so that his \w name|strong="H8034"\w* was \w much|strong="H3966"\w* set \w by|strong="H3365"\w*.\f + \fr 18.30 \ft set by: Heb. precious\f*
